resources.string: Touch to hide all open bubbles
Link Bubble us unable to share this item as it is not a valid URL.
Unable to find application. Consider changing bubble action via Settings.
Link Bubble has been set as the default browser.
Used when one or more non-browser apps on your system can handle a URL.\n\nTap to remove a default.

Used when one or more non-browser apps on your device can handle a URL, you can configure the default app to load such links with.\n\nThe default app to use in this case is configured as you load links with Link Bubble.
Redirect accounts.google.com links to default fallback browser
Link Bubble is not the default browser. Let\'s make it the default shall we?
Note: The restriction of intercepting links from just one app only exists with the free version of Link Bubble. Upgrade to Pro?
Link Bubble configured to load links from %1$s.\nTo load links from all apps, upgrade to Pro.
Display shortcut to load embedded video(s) in the YouTube app.
Note: Current bubbles will be reloaded with the new text zoom applied after selecting \"OK\".
New text zoom level applied. Reloading current bubbles…
Enjoying Link Bubble? Please consider leaving a Play Store review.
Upgrade to Pro for more features.
Remove %1$s as the default app to load %2$s links with?\n\nNote: you can set a new default app to use next time you load a %2$s link.
Android system limitations prevent Link Bubble from selecting this item.\nOpen link in %1$s?
Android system limitations prevent Link Bubble from selecting this item.\nOpen link in a browser.
Link type currently not supported. Open webpage in %1$s?
Link type currently not supported. Open the link a browser.
Android system limitations prevent drop down elements from working in Link Bubble.\nOpen in %1$s?
Android system limitations prevent drop down elements from working in Link Bubble.\nOpen the link in a browser.
Unable to retrieve info about YouTube videos at this time. Please try again later.
Erase your entire Link Bubble browsing history?
Private data cleared. Reloading current bubbles…
Your copy of Link Bubble has been illegally modified and thus will not work reliably. Please reinstall from the Play Store.
Link Bubble Pro is required to load more than one bubble at a time. Upgrade to Pro?
Link Bubble Pro is required to load links from more than one app. Upgrade to Pro?
Valid Link Bubble Pro license detected.\nThank you for supporting this project, and enjoy the app :)
No default browser found on the system.
Will you add support for bookmarks, favorites, extensions, etc.?
Never say never, but for now Link Bubble is focused solely on being the best possible way of loading and consuming links loaded from other apps.
When will you add foreign language translations? Can I help?

I hope to add translation support soon.

When I do, I will definitely put a call out on Twitter (@chrismlacy) for help with translations, so be sure to keep an eye on my feed.
Do you publish a feature roadmap? Can I up-vote upcoming features?
For competitive reasons, the answer to both of these questions is \'no\' I\'m afraid.
Why can\'t I type the name of the link I want to visit?

This is as intended. Link Bubble is designed not to be a complete replacement for your browser, but to instead be used to load and display links from other apps as elegantly, helpfully and as quickly as possible.

If you want to load a new url in Link Bubble, searching for a page via Google Now and loading the result with Link Bubble is a great way of doing so.
Why don\'t drop down menus work?

Unfortunately Android system limitations prevent this from working.

Technical answer: Android\'s WebView hardcodes <select> elements to display via a Dialog, which cannot be launched from a Service. WebView does not provide a means of overriding this behavior. Thus a hack has been added to simply disable drop down items from all pages in Link Bubble. This is far from ideal, but it is certainly better than having the app crash, which is what happens otherwise :\\
Why can\'t I copy text from a web page?

Unfortunately Android system limitations prevent this from working.

Technical answer: Copy functionality works when using Android\'s WebView from an Activity, but not from a Service (which Link Bubble does).
Why doesn\'t the app draw over the translucent status bar?
Unfortunately Android system limitations prevent this.
Is there a beta programme? How can I join?
Details on the beta programme will be announced in due course. Keep an eye on my Google+ (+Chris Lacy) feed for announcements.
Sometimes links doesn\'t display correctly or videos don\'t play.

LinkBubble uses the standard Android WebView, but unfortunately it is sometimes unreliable. Alternative web rendering methods such as FireFox\'s GeckoView and Chromium will likely be investigated going forward.

In the event a web page doesn\'t display correctly in Link Bubble, the easiest thing to do is just to load a traditional browser for that link.
Why does the ongoing notification always display when Link Bubble is running?
Unfortunately this ongoing notification is necessary to encourage the Android OS not to terminate Link Bubble.
When is the next update coming?

When it\'s ready!

It\'s not feasible to be any more specific than that unfortunately (even to provide a ballpark estimate).

The reality is, when estimates are given people often end up taking them as a commitment, and can get upset if/when a release slips for whatever reason.
By continuing, you acknowledge that you accept the Link Bubble terms and privacy policy.
